channel.title: Notes On Korean
channel.description: Recent content on Notes On Korean

item.title: Question Words?
item.description: Yesterday I couldn’t remember the word 언제 (when) for some reason, so I thought I review several question words today. 누구 = who 뭐 = what 언제 = when 어디 = where 왜 = why 어떻게 = how 무슨 = which 얼마 = how much 몇 = how many And some sentences for 언제: 언제 했어요? (When did you do it?) 언제 왔어요? (When did you come?) 언제 일어나요? (When did you get up?

item.title: 미용실 갔어요.
item.description: I went to a Korean hair salon today to get a haircut and (attempt to) practice my korean. It went…okay. Turns out chitchatting with a stranger in Korean for 20+ minutes is really difficult. I go back in 4 weeks and I’m determined to do better next time. Here’s a few words and phrases I hope to use next time. I’ll add more in the next few days. Basics: 미용실 = beauty salon 머리카락 = hair on your head 가위 = scissors 샴푸 = shampoo 린스 = hair conditioner Entering the Salon:

item.title: 안영 하세요!
item.description: I just finished Share Your Work by Austin Kleon. It’s a great (short) book that recommends learning out loud online. Here’s my favorite tidbits from the book: Get obsessed with something and spend a ton of time thinking out loud about it. “The best way to get started on a path…is to think about what you want to learn, and make a commitment to learning it in front of others.”

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Jerry. I’m a husband and dad living in Chicago. My wife was born and raised in Korea and my two kids are both fluent Korean speakers. I’m…working on it. The truth is, learning Korean is hard. I’ve struggled for years to reach fluency, so I started this blog to share what I know with you. Hopefully my successes, and failures, will help you on your own Korean language journey.

item.title: Stuff
item.description: Learn to Type in Korean: TaDak TaDak: Great web app to learn the basics. Fast Fingers (Korean Version): Fun web app to practice getting faster. The english version is pretty fun too. Help with Pronunciation: Motivate Korean’s Perfect Your Korean Pronunciation ($75): The best course I’ve found on korean pronunciation. Sweet and Tasty TV’s Korean Work of the Week Series: A fun, free way to learn korean pronunciation. Courses: Pimsleur’s Learn to Speak and Understand Korean: This is an audio only course available through Audible.
